meanings.definition: The quality or state of being weak or timid
meanings.sent1: Her wimpishnesses were evident when she hesitated to speak up in class.
meanings.sent2: His constant wimpishnesses made him an easy target for bullies.
meanings.sent3: Despite his wimpishnesses, he managed to stand up to the school bully in a surprising turn of events.
meanings.sent4: The wimpishnesses of the small kitten melted everyone's hearts in the animal shelter.
meanings.sent5: The wimpishnesses of the mouse made it an unlikely hero in the children's story.

meanings.definition: Behavior or actions that display a lack of courage or strength
meanings.sent1: The team's wimpishnesses during the game cost them the victory.
meanings.sent2: She was tired of his constant wimpishnesses and wanted him to be more assertive.
meanings.sent3: His wimpishnesses in the face of a spider caused much laughter among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The wimpishnesses of the tree branches bending in the wind showed their fragility.
meanings.sent5: The wimpishnesses of the character added a touch of humor to the play.
